column4: hey people, i just installed ubuntu for a few days, and when i got all video and audio working , there was a breakout
and since them the x server dont go up anymore
iv tryed the sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
and tryed nv, vesa, vga... many drivers, but all of them when i cal the startx
the same error, saying that no drivers wer found
can anyone help me? i dont wanna format the pc
theres some files i need on the home folder...
can you restore your original /etc/X11/xorg.conf, then try startx again and check 'tail /var/log/Xorg.0.log'
did you say this problem began after a power failure?
if it was my system, I would back up all data files and do a fresh installation.
boot a live CD, make a .tar for backup and copy it to one of the Windows drives
you mean you can't mount the partition?
do it in the terminal -- you'll want to run tar in a terminal anyway.
assuming hda1 is the partition you want to mount, the command is 'sudo mount /dev/hda1 /mnt'
are you sure the data you want is on the first partition of hda?
some software is in inofficial repositories (e.g. Adobe Reader, Skype and Google Earth)
others you have to compile from source -- checkinstall can be helpful for that
